question: You are a coding expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable whenever possible. Please help me implement the following requirement using SVG code: create a groom wearing a tailcoat.

checklist.title: Is the groom's basic body structure accurately implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the SVG code correctly implements the groom's basic anatomical structure including head, torso, arms, and legs with proper proportions. The head should be approximately 1/8 of the total body height, shoulders should be 2-3 head widths, and the overall figure should follow human proportional guidelines. Score 0 if basic body structure is missing, 5 if proportions are noticeably incorrect, and 10 if anatomically accurate with proper scaling.

checklist.title: Is the tailcoat design professionally rendered with authentic details?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the tailcoat includes essential formal elements: peaked lapels, double-breasted or single-breasted front, proper tail length extending to behind the knees, fitted waist, and appropriate button placement. Check for formal accessories like bow tie, white dress shirt, and formal trousers. Deduct 5 points if the tailcoat lacks authentic cut details, 3 points if formal accessories are missing, and 2 points if the tail proportions are incorrect. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the SVG structure semantically organized and properly layered?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG uses appropriate grouping with <g> elements, logical layer ordering (background to foreground), and semantic naming conventions. The code should separate different clothing elements (shirt, jacket, trousers) into distinct groups. Deduct 5 points if no grouping structure is used, 3 points if layer ordering causes visual conflicts, and 2 points if element naming is unclear. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the SVG paths and shapes geometrically precise and optimized?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG uses appropriate primitive shapes (rect, circle, ellipse) where suitable and complex paths only when necessary. Check for smooth curves using proper BÃ©zier controls, minimal path points, and accurate coordinate positioning. Deduct 5 points if paths are unnecessarily complex, 3 points if curves appear jagged, and 2 points if coordinates are not optimized. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code can handle common rendering issues across different browsers and screen sizes. The code should include proper viewBox settings, relative scaling, and fallback mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should handle edge cases like extreme viewport sizes and maintain visual integrity. Give 10 points if fully robust, 5 points if moderately robust, and 0 points if no robustness considerations are present.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG includes engaging visual enhancements (e.g., 1. Subtle gradient shading for depth 2. Interactive hover effects 3. Detailed fabric textures 4. Realistic shadow effects). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Duplicate path definitions for similar shapes 2. Unnecessary decorative elements unrelated to the groom figure 3. Overly complex effects that don't enhance the core design. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if redundant code significantly impacts file size or rendering performance.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review SVG code organization, reusable definitions using <defs>, proper use of symbols and patterns, and clean formatting. Deduct 5 points if code is poorly formatted or lacks structure; deduct 5 points if reusable elements aren't properly defined; deduct 5 points if the code is not optimized for file size. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional illustration standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows professional illustration principles: 1) Consistent color palette appropriate for formal wear (blacks, whites, grays with accent colors) 2) Proper contrast ratios for visibility 3) Harmonious proportions and balanced composition. Deduct 3 points for each jarring color choice, 5 points for poor contrast making details hard to see, and 5 points for unbalanced composition. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the visual presentation polished and attention to detail evident?
checklist.description: Judge whether the illustration demonstrates professional attention to detail: 1) Clean, precise lines with consistent stroke weights 2) Proper shading and highlights for dimensional appearance 3) Fine details like buttons, seams, and fabric folds clearly rendered. Deduct 5 points for inconsistent line weights, 3 points for lack of dimensional shading, and 5 points for missing or poorly executed detail work. Full score is 10 points.
